summary:
I am a learning specialist and entrepreneur interested in developing and researching learning ecosystems to drive change. I have experience as an educator, education designer (developed online and offline), and entrepreneurship specialist in helping develop impact-oriented learning/entrepreneurship programs. I've worked at places like the University of Pennsylvania (EDSi) to help empower students, teachers, and education entrepreneurs. I currently work in Europe supporting technology entrepreneurs and researching how to improve entrepreneurial success.

Interested in education, change-making, or entrepreneurship? Send me a message and let's connect.

I'm a former teacher, lifelong learner, and graduate of Penn GSE devoted to discovering innovative and scaleable learning solutions without sacrificing quality.  Personal goals involve altering the ways we approach education by nurturing collaborative learning and honing learner-centric methods to support positive learning outcomes.

school.name: University of Pennsylvania Graduate School of Education

awards.title: Master's Paper (Pass with Distinction)
awards.description:
Received a "Pass with Distinction" from the faculty of the Teaching, Learning, and Leadership Division at the University of Pennsylvania. 

Written about the design of online learning environments in the context of open distance learning and MOOCs. Titled "Cultivating Communities of Practice in Open Distance Learning: Addressing the Psychological and Social Needs of Students in MOOCs".
awards.issuer: University of Pennsylvania Graduate School of Education

certifications.name: Teaching English as a Foreign Language

courses.name: Design of Learning Environments: Theories, Methods, Designs & Applications
Digital Literacies in a Networked World
Information & Communications Technologies For Education & Development in Global Perspective
Virtual Worlds and Video Games as Sites for Learning

profile_positions.description: A genetics information platform helping people make better medical or lifestyle decisions.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description:
- Collected learning content and workshop data for entrepreneurs and supported Program Directors in making improvements to the entrepreneurship curricula.
- Developed Rockstart’s first company-wide data collection system to improve the company's strategic decision making regarding new and existing programs. Trained program directors on importance of data and outcomes mindset.
- Collected quantitative and qualitative data on accelerator stakeholders (investors, startups, and mentors) to identify key improvements for the accelerator programs and ideate on potential new services. Created Rockstart's first customer-based research report analyzing the needs of startups. Led customer discovery for a new artificial intelligence accelerator.
- Conducted a comprehensive industry analysis of accelerators and made recommendations on company strategy.
- Supported ideation, validation, and creation of new services ( through design thinking methodology). Helped develop a new pre-accelerator model in Chisinau, Moldova, and an artificial intelligence accelerator in Den Bosch.
profile_positions.title: Product Optimiser

profile_positions.description:
Envisioning a world where we aren't hampered by fear, and where we learn to see similarities and embrace differences. 

Project Indus is a mission to use technology to bring together students and teachers from all over the globe and empower them to develop crucial skills rooted in globalization. We want to promote dialogue between cultures who live and think differently, and find a shared future together. We, through the feedback of schools and teachers, are developing a platform to empower schools to help their students safely see a world beyond their classroom.

Interested? I would love to connect. Check out 100 Schools for Change: http://projectindus.org/index.php/100-schools/
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description:
I helped develop programming and curriculum for entrepreneurs in education using the most relevant tools and methodologies. I have three years of experience in the education of entrepreneurs (20 companies, $8m raised). My interests are in education, innovation ecosystems, and bringing research to practice in entrepreneurship.

- Managed operations at UPenn GSE’s hybrid incubator and accelerator, Education Design Studio, Inc. (EDSi)
- Selected and managed a portfolio of K-12, Higher Ed, and Lifelong Learning EdTech investments around the world, including early childhood education in Kenya and mobile learning management systems in India. From the three cohorts, early-stage EDSi companies have raised more than $7 million in funding in total, impacting thousands of teachers and 2+ million students from around the world.
- Assisted the development and design of an offline entrepreneurship curriculum and created an online distance learning experience using instructional design.
- Designed and facilitated Design Thinking Workshops for the School District of Philadelphia.
- Facilitated the 2013-2015 Milken-Penn GSE Education Business Plan Competition to bring
entrepreneurs, teachers, researchers, and students together in the education ecosystem. The winning EdTech competitors have received in total more than $140K from strategic partners.
profile_positions.title: Accelerator Program Manager and Edtech Mentor

profile_positions.description:
Served as a Maker mentor in North Philly teaching children how to use technology to design creative projects. Helped children undertake projects that combines STEM education with the arts to foster skills of grit and resilience. Examples include copper tape circuits and e-textiles.

- Mentored students from K-12 in STEM related projects, such as copper tape circuits and basic programming using Scratch.
- Leveraged technology to design fun and creative projects with the students and other Maker Mentors in designated Library maker spaces.
- Observed and evaluated learning outcomes.
profile_positions.title: Maker Mentor

profile_positions.description:
Teaching students to do their best and giving them the tools they need to succeed. Inspiring young thinkers to discover their passions. Focus was on make learning a fun, yet rigorous, process. 

•	Taught fifteen different classes a week in creative writing, critical reasoning, grammar, elementary to high school level math, and debate.
•		Worked with children from the ages of 2-17.
•		Created hundreds of lesson plans synthesizing information for educational purposes. 
•		Designed grammar, public speaking, math, and reading comprehension curricula.
•		Communicated and worked with parents and Administration in improving classes.
•		Represented the Princeton in Asia fellowship program as a teacher.
profile_positions.title: Princeton in Asia Teaching Fellow

profile_positions.description:
Acted as a residential advisor and led a team of seven residents in creating cultural awareness about China in the Middletown community. That included organizing events and programs that centered around Chinese culture.

•		Gained leadership experience by becoming the House manager for a group of seven residents at Wesleyan.
•		Planned programs, shows, and events on campus and in Chinese House for the Wesleyan community.
•		Prepared and organized weekly meetings among team members.
•		Worked with Wesleyan administration, residential life and faculty to increase awareness in the community about the China-	related issues by inviting distinguished speakers, screening documentaries, and holding discussions.
•	Learned Interpersonal skills when working with residents and rest of Residential Life staff.
profile_positions.title: Residential Life House Manager

profile_positions.description:
Researched, organized, and coded data for the Civil Resistance program, which focused on evaluating the effectiveness of non-violent civil resistance movements. My areas of focus were the Middle East and Asia.

•		Researched numerous civil resistance campaigns in the Middle East and East Asia from the early 20th century to present 	day.
•		Learned extensively about tactics used in non-violent civil resistance in comparison to tactics used in terrorism and assessed its 	general effectiveness in present day conflicts.
•	Coded and organized data on Word documents and Excel spreadsheets.
•	Condensed and summarized information for professors.
profile_positions.title: Program on Terrorism and Insurgency Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
As a Student Intern at the Wesleyan fund, my primary responsibilities were data collection, organization of alumni records, and helping out with event planning for alumni events such as homecoming. 

	•		Organized and sent out letters to alumni.
	•		Communicated with alumni and helped organize homecoming at the University.
	•	        Computerized and filed alumni records.
profile_positions.title: Student Intern

profile_positions.description:
Assisted consultants with research and presentations. My job was to analyze different markets and to condense information into a comprehensive and organized presentations which consultants could use.

•		Conducted research into financial institutions and telecommunications market in China.
•		Analyzed and synthesized research into Powerpoint, Excel files, and Word Documents.
•		Communicated with both consultants and clientele.
•	Learned extensively about the consulting industry and financial markets in China.
profile_positions.title: Research Intern

volunteer_experiences.description: Spent two weeks volunteering to clean up, rebuild houses, and demolish old houses in the city of New Orleans, Louisiana with college groups from all over the Northeast.
Taught Chinese senior citizens who needed help passing the U.S. Naturalization test.

skills: Teaching English as a Second Language
